36
37/*
38 * Interface Control Message Protocol Definitions.
39 * Per RFC 792, September 1981.
40 */
41
42/*
43 * Internal of an ICMP Router Advertisement
44 */
45struct icmp_ra_addr {
46 u_int32_t ira_addr;
47 u_int32_t ira_preference;
48};
49
50/*
51 * Structure of an icmp header.
52 */
53struct icmp {
54 u_int8_t icmp_type; /* type of message, see below */
55 u_int8_t icmp_code; /* type sub code */
56 u_int16_t icmp_cksum; /* ones complement cksum of struct */
57 union {
58 u_int8_t ih_pptr; /* ICMP_PARAMPROB */
59 struct in_addr ih_gwaddr; /* ICMP_REDIRECT */
60 struct ih_idseq {
61 int16_t icd_id;
62 int16_t icd_seq;
63 } ih_idseq;
64 int32_t ih_void;
65
66 /* ICMP_UNREACH_NEEDFRAG -- Path MTU Discovery (RFC1191) */
67 struct ih_pmtu {
68 int16_t ipm_void;
69 int16_t ipm_nextmtu;
70 } ih_pmtu;
71 struct ih_rtradv {
72 u_int8_t irt_num_addrs;
73 u_int8_t irt_wpa;
74 u_int16_t irt_lifetime;
75 } ih_rtradv;
76 } icmp_hun;
77#define icmp_pptr icmp_hun.ih_pptr
78#define icmp_gwaddr icmp_hun.ih_gwaddr
79#define icmp_id icmp_hun.ih_idseq.icd_id
80#define icmp_seq icmp_hun.ih_idseq.icd_seq
81#define icmp_void icmp_hun.ih_void
82#define icmp_pmvoid icmp_hun.ih_pmtu.ipm_void
83#define icmp_nextmtu icmp_hun.ih_pmtu.ipm_nextmtu
84#define icmp_num_addrs icmp_hun.ih_rtradv.irt_num_addrs
85#define icmp_wpa icmp_hun.ih_rtradv.irt_wpa
86#define icmp_lifetime icmp_hun.ih_rtradv.irt_lifetime
87 union {
88 struct id_ts {
89 u_int32_t its_otime;
90 u_int32_t its_rtime;
91 u_int32_t its_ttime;
92 } id_ts;
93 struct id_ip {
94 struct ip idi_ip;
95 /* options and then 64 bits of data */
96 } id_ip;
97 struct icmp_ra_addr id_radv;
98 u_int32_t id_mask;
99 int8_t id_data[1];
100 } icmp_dun;
101#define icmp_otime icmp_dun.id_ts.its_otime
102#define icmp_rtime icmp_dun.id_ts.its_rtime
103#define icmp_ttime icmp_dun.id_ts.its_ttime
104#define icmp_ip icmp_dun.id_ip.idi_ip
105#define icmp_radv icmp_dun.id_mask
106#define icmp_mask icmp_dun.id_mask
107#define icmp_data icmp_dun.id_data
108};
109
110/*
111 * Lower bounds on packet lengths for various types.
112 * For the error advice packets must first insure that the
113 * packet is large enought to contain the returned ip header.
114 * Only then can we do the check to see if 64 bits of packet
115 * data have been returned, since we need to check the returned
116 * ip header length.
117 */
118#define ICMP_MINLEN 8 /* abs minimum */
119#define ICMP_TSLEN (8 + 3 * sizeof (u_int32_t)) /* timestamp */
120#define ICMP_MASKLEN 12 /* address mask */
121#define ICMP_ADVLENMIN (8 + sizeof (struct ip) + 8) /* min */
122#define ICMP_ADVLEN(p) (8 + ((p)->icmp_ip.ip_hl << 2) + 8)
123 /* N.B.: must separately check that ip_hl >= 5 */
124
125/*
126 * Definition of type and code field values.
127 */
128#define ICMP_ECHOREPLY 0 /* echo reply */
129#define ICMP_UNREACH 3 /* dest unreachable, codes: */
130#define ICMP_UNREACH_NET 0 /* bad net */
131#define ICMP_UNREACH_HOST 1 /* bad host */
132#define ICMP_UNREACH_PROTOCOL 2 /* bad protocol */
133#define ICMP_UNREACH_PORT 3 /* bad port */
134#define ICMP_UNREACH_NEEDFRAG 4 /* IP_DF caused drop */
135#define ICMP_UNREACH_SRCFAIL 5 /* src route failed */
136#define ICMP_UNREACH_NET_UNKNOWN 6 /* unknown net */
137#define ICMP_UNREACH_HOST_UNKNOWN 7 /* unknown host */
138#define ICMP_UNREACH_ISOLATED 8 /* src host isolated */
139#define ICMP_UNREACH_NET_PROHIB 9 /* prohibited access */
140#define ICMP_UNREACH_HOST_PROHIB 10 /* ditto */
141#define ICMP_UNREACH_TOSNET 11 /* bad tos for net */
142#define ICMP_UNREACH_TOSHOST 12 /* bad tos for host */
143#define ICMP_SOURCEQUENCH 4 /* packet lost, slow down */
144#define ICMP_REDIRECT 5 /* shorter route, codes: */
145#define ICMP_REDIRECT_NET 0 /* for network */
146#define ICMP_REDIRECT_HOST 1 /* for host */
147#define ICMP_REDIRECT_TOSNET 2 /* for tos and net */
148#define ICMP_REDIRECT_TOSHOST 3 /* for tos and host */
149#define ICMP_ECHO 8 /* echo service */
150#define ICMP_ROUTERADVERT 9 /* router advertisement */
151#define ICMP_ROUTERSOLICIT 10 /* router solicitation */
152#define ICMP_TIMXCEED 11 /* time exceeded, code: */
153#define ICMP_TIMXCEED_INTRANS 0 /* ttl==0 in transit */
154#define ICMP_TIMXCEED_REASS 1 /* ttl==0 in reass */
155#define ICMP_PARAMPROB 12 /* ip header bad */
156#define ICMP_PARAMPROB_OPTABSENT 1 /* req. opt. absent */
157#define ICMP_TSTAMP 13 /* timestamp request */
158#define ICMP_TSTAMPREPLY 14 /* timestamp reply */
159#define ICMP_IREQ 15 /* information request */
160#define ICMP_IREQREPLY 16 /* information reply */
161#define ICMP_MASKREQ 17 /* address mask request */
162#define ICMP_MASKREPLY 18 /* address mask reply */
163
164#define ICMP_MAXTYPE 18
165
166#define ICMP_INFOTYPE(type) \
167 ((type) == ICMP_ECHOREPLY || (type) == ICMP_ECHO || \
168 (type) == ICMP_ROUTERADVERT || (type) == ICMP_ROUTERSOLICIT || \
169 (type) == ICMP_TSTAMP || (type) == ICMP_TSTAMPREPLY || \
170 (type) == ICMP_IREQ || (type) == ICMP_IREQREPLY || \
171 (type) == ICMP_MASKREQ || (type) == ICMP_MASKREPLY)
172
173#ifdef _KERNEL
174void icmp_error __P((struct mbuf *, int, int, n_long, struct ifnet *));
175void icmp_input __P((struct mbuf *, ...));
176void icmp_reflect __P((struct mbuf *));
177void icmp_send __P((struct mbuf *, struct mbuf *));
178int icmp_sysctl __P((int *, u_int, void *, size_t *, void *, size_t));
179#endif
